fact: Wendy Carlos' album 'Switched-On Bach', which was created entirely using a Moog synthesizer, is released, bringing synthesized music to a mainstream audience.
Herbie Hancock releases 'Rockit', one of the first hit singles to feature scratching and other turntable techniques, influencing hip hop and electronic music.
The 'Second Summer of Love' is in full swing in the UK, with acid house music and rave culture becoming a major phenomenon.
Aphex Twin releases 'Come to Daddy', an EP that pushed the boundaries of experimental electronic music and became an iconic work of the IDM genre.
Daft Punk's 'Discovery' is released, an album that would become one of the most influential electronic albums of all time, blending house, disco, and synth-pop.
Kraftwerk's 'Trans-Europe Express' is released, a seminal album that would influence genres from hip hop to techno with its electronic sounds and themes of travel.
The Roland TR-909 Rhythm Composer is released, and its drum sounds would go on to define the sound of techno and house music.
Massive Attack releases 'Blue Lines', an album that is considered the blueprint for the trip-hop genre, blending hip hop rhythms with dub and soul.
Plastikman (Richie Hawtin) releases 'Sheet One', a landmark album in minimalist acid techno.
Justice releases their debut album 'â€ ' (Cross), which becomes a cornerstone of the electro-house and bloghaus era.
